intro: Platanthera mandarinorum subsp. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan lady's tresses, is an orchid native to Taiwan. It is characterized by its dense, dark green leaves and a striking inflorescence of white to pale pink flowers that resemble a tresses of hair. The plant thrives in moist, shaded forest environments, often growing on rocky substrates. It is a perennial herb with a rhizomatous root system, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that are pollinated by insects. Due to habitat loss, this subspecies is considered rare and is of conservation interest.
